root.title: Chaa-Hol VIII (е-20)
root.place:
Monuments of this group were found in a valley near the river Chaa-Hol, the left inflow of Ulug-Hem, in 25 km above the mouth of river Hemchik. This district is on the bottom of water basin Sayano-Shushenskii now. All monuments of the group, except Е 15, are in museum exhibitions.
E 20 was found in the district on left coast of the river Chaa-Hol in 8 km from its mouth.
root.store: Researchers moved the stele to the Tyva museum in 1961.
root.general: Made of gray-green slate. Almost square in section. The facade is processed. The lateral sides are roughly squared.
root.description: The epitaph text in 2 lines is located vertically on the processed face. There is a tamga below the inscription.
root.size: Height – 179 cm, length – 34 cm, width – 48 cm
root.investigation: Aspelin found in 1888, following the message of Safyanov. Heikel made a photo of it in 1889 121 (I, XI). Oshurkov made a copy and transferred it to Radloff 122 (LXXXVII, figs. 5). The text is studied by S.E.Malov, H.N.Orkun, I.V.Kormushin, etc.
